channel.title: Allow us to remove our own polls
channel.description:
People like me, who are not sure when they will close their polls, will find themselves in a situation where the User cannot remove their poll and simply can just put a bunch *s to note that this poll is done.
What's the point of not allowing us to remove our own polls?

item.title: Allow us to remove our own polls
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Davidi2:

No real reason. If you want a poll removed you can tell a moderator or properly use the time feature . The reason we dont allow people to remove their own polls is so that people can’t remove them if they get a result they don’t like, really abusing the system.

that’s how companies usually do it

Read full topic
item.source: Allow us to remove our own polls

item.source: Allow us to remove our own polls

item.title: Allow us to remove our own polls
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:7, topic:535479”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654289.msg4383055#msg4383055 date=1384225382]
maybe not remove but have timed polls? can make them inactive/not have the poll counted as an active one would allow you to place a new one up?
[/quote]
You clearly didn’t read the thread and just read the title.

[quote author=arham 4 link=topic=654289.msg4382826#msg4382826 date=1384146126]
People like me, who are not sure when they will close their polls, will find themselves in a situation where the User cannot remove their poll and simply can just put a bunch *s to note that this poll is done.
[/quote][/quote]

There comes a certain point where polls will stop receiving votes, and you’ll generally have all of the required feedback that you would have received from the poll, so factor that in when using timed polls. Whether that’s a week, or 3 days, it depends.

I can only assume that you mean to use polls for your server development, so in that case I’d recommend leaving a poll up for a week, after that point you should have any required feedback that you’d need.

Read full topic
item.source: Allow us to remove our own polls

item.title: Allow us to remove our own polls
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:7, topic:535479”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654289.msg4383055#msg4383055 date=1384225382]
maybe not remove but have timed polls? can make them inactive/not have the poll counted as an active one would allow you to place a new one up?
[/quote]
You clearly didn’t read the thread and just read the title.

[quote author=arham 4 link=topic=654289.msg4382826#msg4382826 date=1384146126]
People like me, who are not sure when they will close their polls, will find themselves in a situation where the User cannot remove their poll and simply can just put a bunch *s to note that this poll is done.
[/quote][/quote]It’s called an alternative

I read your post, but I support and also do not support. We don’t need people removing their polls when they rage or something. Nor do we need people having the power to remove posts really.

Read full topic
item.source: Allow us to remove our own polls
